page.title: 02THE FYLINGDALES LANDSCAPE
page.content: Along the road is St. Stephen's Church with a saddle back tower and graveyard.Further along is the village of Robin Hoods Bay at the bottom of a 1:3 hill. You are not allowed to take your car down to the sea where the old fishermen's houses cluster together on the hillside. Now there is little fishing and few local people live in the old village. Beyond the slipway rocky scars lead out to the cold grey North Sea. The beach is interesting. You can find fossils, shells and rocks, some from other countries. There are small patches of sand where you can play. At the top of Bay Bank the houses are not so old. There is an estate called Mount Pleasant built when the railway first came to accommodate holiday makers and retired people.
